profileText: A Representative from Georgia; born in Shelby County, Tenn., October 28, 1834; attended the University of Mississippi at Oxford, and was graduated from the Lebanon (Tenn.) Law School in 1856; was admitted to the bar in 1857 and commenced the practice of law in Memphis, Tenn.; moved to Augusta, Ga., in 1860; served in the Confederate Army during the Civil War as colonel of the Fifteenth Regiment, Georgia Volunteer Infantry, and subsequently became brigadier general in the Western Army; moved to Washington, Wilkes County, Ga.; elected as a Democrat to the Forty-second Congress (March 4, 1871-March 3, 1873); resumed the practice of law; died in Washington, Ga., March 2, 1883; interment in Rest Haven Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: In the James P. Hambleton Papers, 1857-1893, 0.25 linear foot.

recordLocation.name: Special Collections Department, Robert W. Woodruff Library

researchRecord.name: In the Alexander Hamilton Stephens Papers, ca. 1821-1969, 4.5 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers include correspondence between John A. Stephens and Dudley DuBose.

recordLocation.name: Special Collections Department, Robert W. Woodruff Library
